New Records: Jack Grealish opened the scoring with a cool finish after a lovely flick from Angel Gomes.
Trent Alexander-Arnold bent home a sumptuous free kick from a position to the left of centre to make it 2-0.
Key Match Events: Grealish injected the urgency, surging off the left to find Alexander-Arnold and dart for the area.
Declan Rice got the third from a cross by Ollie Watkins.
Finland’s late consolation, Arttu Hoskonen running free to head home from a corner, was little more than a minor irritation for England.
Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley needed a return to the tranquil progress of his first camp in September.
England had dominated against Finland at Wembley in Carsley’s second game, creating so many chances and it was a night when control was the theme.
Post-Match Reflections: The win helped shift focus away from the previous loss against Greece.
Carsley’s role and the team’s style of play were major themes following the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The article mentions the team's style being more conventional, which could be an 'Other' point.
